animal.name: African Elephant
animal.description: The African Elephant is the largest land animal, known for its intelligence and memory.

animal.name: Siberian Tiger
animal.description: This big cat lives in snowy forests and is a powerful solitary predator.

animal.name: Western Lowland Gorilla
animal.description: The largest living primate, known for its intelligence and gentle nature.

animal.name: Giant Panda
animal.description: This bamboo-eating bear is a global conservation icon.

animal.name: Red Kangaroo
animal.description: The largest marsupial, capable of leaping up to 9 meters in a single bound.

animal.name: Polar Bear
animal.description: The largest land carnivore, perfectly adapted to Arctic conditions.

animal.name: Ring-tailed Lemur
animal.description: This charismatic primate from Madagascar uses its striped tail for communication.

animal.name: Capybara
animal.description: The world's largest rodent, native to South American wetlands.

animal.name: Meerkat
animal.description: These highly social mongooses stand guard to protect their colonies.

animal.name: Red Fox
animal.description: An adaptable canid with remarkable intelligence and hunting skills.

animal.name: Two-toed Sloth
animal.description: This slow-moving arboreal mammal spends most of its life upside down.

animal.name: Platypus
animal.description: An egg-laying mammal with a duck-like bill and venomous spurs.

animal.name: Macaw
animal.description: A brilliantly colored parrot native to Central and South America.

animal.name: Bald Eagle
animal.description: The national bird of the United States, known for its sharp vision and soaring flight.

animal.name: Southern Cassowary
animal.description: A large flightless bird with a distinctive casque and powerful legs.

animal.name: Greater Flamingo
animal.description: These pink wading birds filter-feed with their specialized bills.

animal.name: Snowy Owl
animal.description: A magnificent white owl adapted to Arctic regions.

animal.name: Peacock
animal.description: Known for the male's extravagant tail feathers used in courtship displays.

animal.name: Emperor Penguin
animal.description: The tallest and heaviest penguin species, adapted to Antarctic life.

animal.name: Toco Toucan
animal.description: This large toucan has an oversized but lightweight bill for reaching fruit.

animal.name: Secretary Bird
animal.description: A long-legged raptor that hunts snakes by stamping on them.

animal.name: Kookaburra
animal.description: This Australian kingfisher is famous for its laughing call.

animal.name: Andean Condor
animal.description: One of the world's largest flying birds with a 3-meter wingspan.

animal.name: Kiwi
animal.description: New Zealand's flightless national icon with hair-like feathers.

animal.name: Komodo Dragon
animal.description: The world's largest lizard, found in Indonesia.

animal.name: Green Iguana
animal.description: A large, tree-dwelling herbivore found throughout Central and South America.

animal.name: Gal√°pagos Tortoise
animal.description: The world's largest tortoise that can live over 100 years.

animal.name: Black Mamba
animal.description: Africa's longest venomous snake, capable of speeds up to 20 km/h.

animal.name: American Alligator
animal.description: A large crocodilian native to the southeastern United States.

animal.name: Veiled Chameleon
animal.description: Known for its color-changing ability and distinctive casque.

animal.name: Gila Monster
animal.description: One of only two venomous lizards in the world.

animal.name: Reticulated Python
animal.description: The world's longest snake species, capable of reaching over 6 meters.

animal.name: Leatherback Sea Turtle
animal.description: The largest turtle species, distinguished by its leathery shell.

animal.name: Frilled Lizard
animal.description: When threatened, it raises its spectacular frill to appear larger.

animal.name: Tuataras
animal.description: Ancient reptiles that have survived unchanged for 200 million years.

animal.name: Nile Crocodile
animal.description: Africa's largest freshwater predator with immense bite force.

animal.name: Red-Eyed Tree Frog
animal.description: Famous for its bulging red eyes and vibrant green body, it's native to rainforests.

animal.name: Axolotl
animal.description: A unique salamander that retains its larval features into adulthood.

animal.name: Poison Dart Frog
animal.description: These brightly colored frogs secrete potent toxins through their skin.

animal.name: Chinese Giant Salamander
animal.description: The world's largest amphibian, reaching up to 1.8 meters in length.

animal.name: Fire Salamander
animal.description: This striking black and yellow amphibian was once thought to be born from fire.

animal.name: Surinam Toad
animal.description: Known for its extremely flat body and unique reproductive habits.

animal.name: Japanese Giant Toad
animal.description: A large toad that plays an important role in Japanese folklore.

animal.name: Mudpuppy
animal.description: A permanently aquatic salamander with external gills.

animal.name: African Bullfrog
animal.description: One of the largest frogs that can grow up to 23 cm in length.

animal.name: Hellbender
animal.description: North America's largest aquatic salamander with a flattened body.

animal.name: Glass Frog
animal.description: Named for their translucent skin that reveals internal organs.

animal.name: Alpine Newt
animal.description: A colorful newt species native to central and southern Europe.

animal.name: Clownfish
animal.description: A colorful reef fish that forms symbiotic relationships with sea anemones.

animal.name: Great White Shark
animal.description: A powerful ocean predator with a reputation that precedes it.

animal.name: Lionfish
animal.description: Venomous coral reef fish with striking striped fins.

animal.name: Manta Ray
animal.description: Graceful filter feeders with the largest brain of all fish.

animal.name: Electric Eel
animal.description: Capable of generating up to 600 volts of electricity for hunting.

animal.name: Piranha
animal.description: Notorious for their sharp teeth and powerful bite.

animal.name: Seahorse
animal.description: Unique fish where males carry the developing young.

animal.name: Stonefish
animal.description: The world's most venomous fish, perfectly camouflaged as a rock.

animal.name: Arapaima
animal.description: One of the largest freshwater fish, capable of breathing air.

animal.name: Clown Triggerfish
animal.description: Brightly colored reef fish with a distinctive pattern.

animal.name: Whale Shark
animal.description: The largest fish species, a gentle giant that feeds on plankton.

animal.name: Coelacanth
animal.description: A "living fossil" thought extinct until rediscovered in 1938.

animal.name: Monarch Butterfly
animal.description: Known for its epic migrations and bright orange wings.

animal.name: Atlas Beetle
animal.description: A large beetle from Southeast Asia, named after the mythical Titan Atlas.

animal.name: Goliath Beetle
animal.description: One of the heaviest insects, with some adults reaching 100 grams.

animal.name: Praying Mantis
animal.description: Predatory insects with excellent vision and lightning-fast reflexes.

animal.name: Stick Insect
animal.description: Masters of camouflage that resemble twigs or leaves.

animal.name: Tarantula Hawk
animal.description: A wasp with one of the most painful stings in the insect world.

animal.name: Blue Morpho Butterfly
animal.description: Brilliant blue butterflies from Central and South America.

animal.name: Hercules Beetle
animal.description: One of the largest beetles with impressive horns.

animal.name: Leafcutter Ant
animal.description: Highly social ants that cultivate fungus gardens.

animal.name: Giant Water Bug
animal.description: Large predatory insects that can deliver a painful bite.

animal.name: Atlas Moth
animal.description: One of the largest moths with a wingspan up to 30 cm.

animal.name: Bombardier Beetle
animal.description: Can shoot a boiling chemical spray from its abdomen.
